question: How do I find my password to connect to the new clusters?
answer: Your password for connecting to new clusters is the same one you use to connect to CCDB.

question: Where can I find my username for logging into the clusters?
answer: Your username is displayed at the top of your CCDB homepage.

question: Who organizes the training workshops?
answer: Most training workshops are organized by regional partners.

question: In what formats are the training workshops offered?
answer: The training workshops are offered either online or in person.

question: What levels of expertise do the training workshops cater to?
answer: The workshops are offered for all levels of expertise.

question: Which regional partner provides training in British Columbia and the Prairie provinces?
answer: WestDRI provides training in British Columbia and the Prairie provinces.

question: Where can I find WestDRI's training materials and information on upcoming sessions?
answer: You can find WestDRI's training materials on their website at https://training.westdri.ca. Click on the image for 'Upcoming sessions' or explore the navigation menu.

question: Does WestDRI offer a specific bootcamp?
answer: Yes, WestDRI offers the UAlberta ARC Bootcamp.

question: What training resources does SHARCNET offer in Ontario?
answer: SHARCNET in Ontario offers a calendar (https://www.sharcnet.ca/my/news/calendar), a YouTube channel (http://youtube.sharcnet.ca/), and online workshops (https://training.sharcnet.ca/).

question: What training resources does SciNet offer in Ontario?
answer: SciNet in Ontario provides an Education Site (https://education.scinet.utoronto.ca) and a YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/c/SciNetHPCattheUniversityofToronto).

question: Where can I find training events and general training information for Calcul Québec?
answer: Calcul Québec's events are available at https://calculquebec.eventbrite.ca/ and general training information at https://www.calculquebec.ca/services-aux-chercheurs/formation/.

question: What resources does ACENET provide for training in the Atlantic provinces?
answer: ACENET in the Atlantic provinces offers a training page (https://www.ace-net.ca/training.html) and a YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/@ACENETDRI YouTube).

question: Where can I find a consolidated calendar of all training workshops from the regional partners?
answer: All workshops are grouped on the Federation's training calendar at https://alliancecan.ca/fr/services/calcul-informatique-de-pointe/soutien-la-recherche/calendrier-de-formation.

question: How can I determine which systems best meet my specific needs?
answer: It's not easy to answer this directly as systems can meet a wide range of needs. You should contact technical support for clarification.

question: What software-related questions should I consider when trying to identify relevant resources?
answer: You should consider: what software you want to use, if it needs a commercial license, if it can operate without user intervention (e.g., controlled by a command file or requiring a user interface), and if it can run on Linux.

question: What resource requirements should I estimate for a typical task when seeking system recommendations?
answer: For a typical task, you should estimate needs in terms of memory, time, processing power, accelerators, storage space, network bandwidth, etc.

question: What other operational information about tasks is helpful for identifying appropriate resources?
answer: You should also specify how frequently a typical task will be executed.

question: What if I don't know the answers to the questions about my resource needs?
answer: If you don't know the answers to these questions, the technical team can guide you and indicate the appropriate resources.
